intro: Licaria triplicalyx, commonly known as the three-lobed licaria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three distinct leaflets. Its showy, pinkish-white flowers bloom in clusters and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and unique morphology, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and specialty nurseries.
